txt.en: Too near Stangard, you see a den of vile, slavering dogs preying upon the lands
This is a good vantage point
In the Wailing Hills you see Orcs and more Orcs, roaming the lands as if they own them
The watch-duties have not been performed in many long months in Stangard, and Sabert is unable to leave his post at the gate.
This is a good vantage point
Far in the distance, you note rocky channels swarming with vile worms
This is a good vantage point
You see nothing noteworthy from this vantage point
This is a good vantage point

'It has been months since anyone has been posted on any of the watch-towers, [placeholder]. Men go out to hunt or gather to bolster our stores, and too many die on the way because they do not know what faces them.\n\n'It would be a great help to us if you could just climb the watch-towers and look at what roams Eorlsmead and the Wailing Hills.'
Watch-towers have been built around the perimeter of Stangard.\n\nYou should climb the perimeter watch-towers and <rgb=#FF0000>look</rgb> out at the Wailing Hills and Eorlsmead.

'You must be jesting, [placeholder]. You did watch-duty? No one has done watch-duty since Sithric came here. Please, tell me what you saw from the towers.'

Gadda listens gravely as you tell him what you saw from your high vantage point.

'Orcs to our west, worms and wicked beasts to our east, and a haunted wood to the north. Things have worsened for us since the patrols lessened. Now there is no hope of us getting food from Eorlsmead without losing many men to the predators that roam the river-lands.'
Gadda can be found near the Mead Hall in Stangard.\n\nYou should report what you saw to Gadda.
Gadda can be found near the Mead Hall in Stangard.\n\nYou should report what you saw to Gadda.
'You can enter the watch-towers through the doors and look out once you reach the top. Only the perimeter towers will have good vantage points.'

'You must be jesting, [placeholder]. You did watch-duty? No one has done watch-duty since Sithric came here. Please, tell me what you saw from the towers.'

Gadda listens gravely as you tell him what you saw from your high vantage point.

'Orcs to our west, worms and wicked beasts to our east, and a haunted wood to the north. Things have worsened for us since the patrols lessened. Now there is no hope of us getting food from Eorlsmead without losing many men to the predators that roam the river-lands.'
Perform watch-tower duty ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
Talk to Gadda about the dangers you saw
